text:
HI Team,

Can anyone help me creating a workflow to trigger 3rd API on any form submit in HubSpot?

Seems like this has been changed. According to this doc you are now allowed to resubscribe contacts<https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/api/marketing/subscriptions-preferences#post-%2Fcommunication-preferences%2Fv3%2Fresubscribe>
Hi Krishna, I don't think there's a workflow trigger for form submit event but you can make a trigger from the object where the form data is created and call whatever API you want in your workflow.
Can you please provide the millis that comes from your conversion so I can check if it was valid?

Thanks for the info. Actually i have used that workflow by using the object created date as the trigger. But looking for one of the option where we need to have the form data to be sent to 3rd party API by using workflow.
You could try the trigger to send a webhook on object create event but that will trigger for all create event for that object.
I think I would use custom-coded action after the trigger and then code the action to send what ever data I want to the 3rd-party api

Hi <@U06PD9GMMV5> I think you'd be able to do what you want from the Copy property value action. Set property and Copy property can. both "copy" but as you noticed our new widget that provides additional data options is more limited in Set Property. We're actively working on eliminating this restriction.
Ah, that'll work. I can use the copy property action to accomplish the same thing as the set property action. Perfect, thanks a bunch.
